body.head: CHAPTER II. LYNCH LAW STATISTICS
body.p: From the record published in the Chicago Tribune, January 1, 1894, the following computation of lynching statistics is made referring only to the colored victims of Lynch Law during the year 1893:

ARSON.
Sept. 15, Paul Hill, Carrollton, Ala.;Alabama Sept. 15, Paul Archer, Carrollton,Ala.;Alabama Sept. 15, William Archer, Carrollton, Ala.Alabama Sept. 15, Emma Fair, Carrollton, Ala.Alabama

SUSPECTED ROBBERY.
Dec. 23, unknown negro, Fannin, Miss.Mississippi

ASSAULT.
Dec. 25, Calvin Thomas, near Brainbridge, Ga.Georgia

ATTEMPTED ASSAULT.
Dec. 28, Tillman Green, Columbia, La.Louisiana

INCENDIARISM.
Jan. 26, Patrick Wells, Quincy, Fla.; Feb. 9, Frank Harrell, Dickery, Miss.Mississippi Feb. 9, William Filder, Dickery, Miss.Mississippi

ATTEMPTED RAPE.
Feb. 21, Richard Mays, Springville, Mo.;Missouri Aug. 14, Dug Hazleton, Carrollton, Ga.;Georgia Sept. 1, Judge McNeil, Cadiz, Ky.;Kentucky Sept. 11, Frank Smith, Newton, Miss.Mississippi Sept. 16, William Jackson, Nevada, Mo.;Missouri Sept. 19, Riley Gulley, Pine Apple, Ala.Alabama Oct. 9, John Davis, Shorterville, Ala.Alabama Nov. 8, Robert Kennedy, Spartansburg, S. C.

BURGLARY.
Feb. 16, Richard Forman, Granada, Miss.Mississippi

WIFE BEATING.
Oct. 14, David Jackson, Covington, La.Louisiana.

ATTEMPTED MURDER.
Sept. 21, Thomas Smith, Roanoke, Va.Virginia

ATTEMPTED ROBBERY.
Dec. 12, four unknown negroes, near Selma, Ala.;Alabama
